summary: Website with a Valentine's Day themed landing page and CTA that navigates to a second screen displaying a realistic, centered coupon with specified details and mindful Valentine's color palette.
architectural_notes: Fix routing architecture in App.tsx: ensure RouterProvider is instantiated once at the top-level and route components (e.g., rootRoute) render via <Outlet /> rather than trying to render <RouterProvider> inside a route definition.
known_issues: Runtime crash prevents review: App.tsx uses the router before it is created (rootRoute renders <RouterProvider router={router}> but router is defined later).
Deployment error is preventing the draft from being promoted/deployed to live.

existing_features.title: Create a Valentine’s Day themed landing screen that displays a beautiful Valentine’s Day message and a prominent CTA button labeled exactly: "click to avail your Valentine's day coupon".
Apply a lovely full-page background that covers the entire visible page area (no plain/unstyled whitespace) on the landing screen, consistent with a Valentine’s Day theme.
Implement navigation so that clicking the landing-page CTA transitions the user to a second screen (new route/view) dedicated to displaying the coupon.

On the second screen, render a realistic-looking coupon card placed at the center of the screen (both vertically and horizontally) with the following exact text content and hierarchy: Header: "Free Kisses and Hugs"; then fields: "To: Shubham Kumar", "Users: Unlimited", "Expiration: Never", "Redemption Code: Your deep, romantic voice".

Use a mindful Valentine’s Day color palette and ensure the styling across both screens looks "beautiful" and cohesive; choose one distinct visual theme (typography, spacing, and UI styling) and apply it consistently (avoid default/template styling).

Add and use generated static image assets for the full-page background and (optionally) subtle coupon texture, stored in frontend/public/assets/generated, and reference them directly from the frontend (do not route images through the backend).

Fix the runtime crash in frontend/src/App.tsx by restructuring the TanStack Router setup so that no route component references the router instance before it is created (e.g., the root route must not render <RouterProvider router={router}> while router is defined later).

Fix the TanStack Router initialization in frontend/src/App.tsx so that no route component references the router instance before it is created. Specifically, remove <RouterProvider router={router}> from the root route component and render an <Outlet /> (or equivalent) in the root route instead, and ensure <RouterProvider router={router}> is rendered only once inside App() after the router is created.
Add a simple in-app "Edit text" mode that lets the user update the key text strings shown on the Valentine landing page and the coupon card, without requiring code changes.
Persist the edited text values locally in the browser so the customized text remains after a page refresh.
Preserve the current shipped default copy as the initial values shown before any edits are made, including the existing required CTA label and coupon field defaults.
Promote the currently deployed draft version of the Valentine’s app to the live production environment (make the draft go live) without changing application code.
After the deployment/build error is resolved, promote the currently deployed draft version of the Valentine’s app to the live production environment (make the draft go live).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a Valentine's Day landing page with a beautiful message, full-page lovely background, and a CTA button labeled "click to avail your Valentine's day coupon".
Implement CTA navigation to a second screen that displays a realistic, centered Valentine's-themed coupon.
Design the coupon to include: header "Free Kisses and Hugs"; To: Shubham Kumar; Users: Unlimited; Expiration: Never; Redemption Code: Your deep, romantic voice.
Apply a mindful Valentine's Day color palette and overall beautiful styling across both screens.
Allow editing/updating a few text strings in the app (e.g., landing page message/CTA and/or coupon text).
Promote the currently deployed draft version of the app to the live production environment (i.e., make the draft go live) without changing application code.
Fix the deployment/build error so the app can be deployed successfully and made live (go live).
Identify and fix the deployment/build error that is preventing the Valentine app from deploying successfully, ensuring the project builds and deploys cleanly.

projectName: Valentine’s Day landing page with CTA navigation to a realistic coupon screen
